channel.title: Markdown - Today I Learnt...
channel.description: Recent content in Markdown on Today I Learnt...

item.title: About `pycon` markdown format
item.description: Github-flavoured markdown uses Linguist for syntax highlighting, and Linguist supports “Python console” as a language.

item.title: Some Markdown parsers support definition lists
item.description: Parsers like goldmark (the default parser for Hugo) support definition lists.

item.title: How to use `markdownlint` output in Vim's quickfix list
item.description: The output from markdownlint-cli has this form: path/to/file.md:13:81 MD013/line-length Line length [Expected: 80; Actual: 102] which doesn’t load correctly into Vim’s quickfix list (via :cfile or :cexpr).

item.title: How to spell-check markdown repos on CircleCI
item.description: The tmaier/markdown-spellcheck Docker image wraps node-markdown-spellcheck and can be used locally and on CircleCI to spell-check markdown files.

item.title: Vim-markdown has some useful commands
item.description: I use sheerun/vim-polyglot but disable its markdown support in favour of plasticboy/vim-markdown.

item.title: How to embed markdown content in a Github code block
item.description: Normally, fenced code blocks are delimited with triple backticks ```.
